law.text:
Notwithstanding any provision in the charter or bylaws, the secretary of a corporation may call a special meeting of stockholders only:
On the written request of the stockholders entitled to cast at least a majority of all the votes entitled to be cast at the meeting; and
In accordance with the procedures set forth under § 2-502(b)(2) and (3) and (e) of this article.
